title: Jyoti Basu
summary: Jyoti Basu (born Jyotirindra Basu; 8 July 1914 â€“ 17 January 2010)[1] was an Indian politician who served as the Chief Minister of West Bengal state from 1977 to 2000.[2][3][4] He was one of the co-founders of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and a member of the Polit Bureau of the party since its inception in 1964 till 2008.[5] He was noted to have been the longest serving chief minister in an elected democracy, at the time of his resignation.[6][lower-alpha 1]
